info.author: Cem Baybars GÜÇLÜ
info.description:
# ImLine the image marking and angular face map creating software. #### Supported Environments | | | |-------------------------|-----------------------------------------| | **Operating systems** | Linux | | **Python versions** | Python 3.x (64-bit) | | **Distros** | Ubuntu | | **Package managers** | APT, pip | | **Languages** | English | | | | ### Installation Clone the GitHub repository and run ```Shell sudo ./install.sh ``` in the repository directory. for development mode: `sudo ./install-dev.sh` If there is a failure try `sudo -H ./install-dev.sh` ### Usage ``` usage: imline [-h] [--ripe-dataset RIPE_DATASET] [--environment {production,development,testing}] [-v] [--version] {set-key-points} ... positional arguments: {set-key-points} officiate the sub-jobs set-key-points Mark key-points of the given images to the ImLine. optional arguments: -h, --help show this help message and exit Others: --ripe-dataset RIPE_DATASET Images folder that keeps already marked images and their key-points's JSON data. --environment {production,development,testing} The running environment. It specify the configuration files and logs. To use: either `production`, `development` or `testing`. Default is production -v, --verbose Print various debugging logs to console for debug problems --version Display the version number of ImLine. ```
**Supported Distributions:** Linux Mint. This release is fully supported. Any other Debian based distributions are partially supported. ### Contribute If you want to contribute to T_System then please read [this guide]().
info.keywords: image processing computer vision face mapping key-points
info.name: imline
info.summary: imline is key point marker and angular map creator on a face
info.html_description:
ImLine

the image marking and angular face map creating software.

Supported Environments
Operating systems Linux
Python versions Python 3.x (64-bit)
Distros Ubuntu
Package managers APT, pip
Languages English

Installation

Clone the GitHub repository and run

sudo ./install.sh

in the repository directory.

for development mode: sudo ./install-dev.sh

If there is a failure try sudo -H ./install-dev.sh

Usage

usage: imline [-h] [--ripe-dataset RIPE_DATASET]
              [--environment {production,development,testing}] [-v]
              [--version]
              {set-key-points} ...

positional arguments:
  {set-key-points}      officiate the sub-jobs
    set-key-points      Mark key-points of the given images to the ImLine.

optional arguments:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit

Others:
  --ripe-dataset RIPE_DATASET
                        Images folder that keeps already marked images and
                        their key-points's JSON data.
  --environment {production,development,testing}
                        The running environment. It specify the configuration
                        files and logs. To use: either `production`,
                        `development` or `testing`. Default is production
  -v, --verbose         Print various debugging logs to console for debug
                        problems
  --version             Display the version number of ImLine.

Supported Distributions: Linux Mint. This release is fully supported. Any other Debian based distributions are partially supported.

Contribute

If you want to contribute to T_System then please read this guide.
